article.title: Ann_Arbor%2C_Michigan

template.arg: A2("A" Squared), A2 ("A"-two), Tree Town, The People's Republic of Ann Arbor
Ann Arbor is located in southeast Michigan

article.paragraph: Ann Arboris acityin the US state ofMichiganand thecounty seatofWashtenaw County, MichiganWashtenaw County.cite webhttp://clarke.cmich.edu/resource_tab/bibliographies_of_clarke_library_material/michigan_local_history/county_material/washtenaw.html[[Charles V. Park Library|Clarke Historical Library]], [[Central Michigan University]]Bibliography on Washtenaw County23 January 2013The2010 United States Census2010 censusrecorded its population to be 113,934, making it theList of municipalities in Michigan (by population)sixth largest city in Michigan.Population of Michigan Cities, Villages, Townships, and Remainders of Townships. www.michigan.gov.The Ann ArborMetropolitan Statistical Area(MSA) includes all of Washtenaw County, which had a population of 344,791 as of 2010. The city is also part of the largerMetro DetroitDetroitAnn ArborFlint, MICombined Statistical Area(CSA).

Ann Arbor was founded in 1824, named for wives of the village's founders and the stands ofQuercus macrocarpaBur Oaktrees.Marwil, pp. 12TheUniversity of Michiganmoved from Detroit to Ann Arbor in 1837, and the city showed steady growth throughout the 19th and 20th centuries, except during theLong DepressionDepression of 1873. During the 1960s and 1970s, the city gained a reputation as a center for left-wing politics. Ann Arbor became a focal point for political activism and served as a hub for theAmerican civil rights movementcivil-rights movementandOpposition to U.S. involvement in the Vietnam Waranti-Vietnam War movement, as well as various student movements.

Ann Arbor is home to theUniversity of Michigan, one of the foremost research universities in the United States. The university shapes Ann Arbor's economy significantly as it employs about 30,000 workers, including about 12,000 in theUniversity of Michigan Health Systemmedical center. The city's economy is also centered on high technology, with several companies drawn to the area by the university's research and development money, and by its graduates.cite webhttp://www.city-data.com/us-cities/The-Midwest/Ann-Arbor-Introduction.htmlAnn Arbor: IntroductionAdvameg, Inc.20084 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20130610084107/http://www.city-data.com/us-cities/The-Midwest/Ann-Arbor-Introduction.html2013-06-10
article.heading: History
article.paragraph: MainHistory of Ann Arbor, Michigansee alsoHistory of the University of MichiganAnn Arbor was founded in 1824 by land speculatorsJohn Allen (pioneer)John AllenandElisha Walker Rumsey. On 25 May 1824, the townplatwas registered with Wayne County as "Annarbour;" this represents the earliest known use of the town's name.Marwil, p. 1Allen and Rumsey decided to name it for their wives, both named Ann, and for the stands of Bur Oak in theconvert640acrehaof land they purchased for $800 from the federal government at $1.25 per acre.The localOjibwe peopleOjibwanamed the settlementkaw-goosh-kaw-nick, after the sound of Allen'ssawmill.cite bookMichigan State Historical Society, Michigan Pioneer and Historical SocietyMichigan History Magazine1964Michigan Historical Commission31

File:AnnArborLibertyStreet.JPGleftthumbalt=Aerial view of a city downtown, showing the Michigan Theater and a Borders in the foreground, and several buildings amongst trees in the backgroundA view of Ann Arbor looking east toward Liberty and State streets, showing theBurton Memorial Tower,Michigan Theater (Ann Arbor)Michigan Theater, the formerBorders GroupBordersbookstore No. 1, and several buildings of the University of MichiganAnn Arbor became the seat of Washtenaw County in 1827,Marwil, p. 4and was incorporated as a village in 1833.Marwil, p. 7The Ann Arbor Land Company, a group of speculators, set asideconvert40acrehaof undeveloped land and offered it to the state of Michigan as the site of the state capital, but lost the bid toLansing, MichiganLansing. In 1837, the property was accepted instead as the site of theUniversity of Michigan, which moved from Detroit.Marwil, p. 13

Since the university's establishment in the city in 1837, the histories of the University of Michigan and Ann Arbor have been closely linked.cite webhttp://moaa.aadl.org/moaa/pictorial_history/1824-1859pg31824–1859: Education. ''Pictorial History of Ann Arbor: 1824–1974''2006Ann Arbor District Library4 December 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20140221201546/http://moaa.aadl.org/moaa/pictorial_history/1824-1859pg32014-02-21The town became a regional transportation hub in 1839 with the arrival of theMichigan Central Railroad, and a northsouth railway connecting Ann Arbor toToledo, OhioToledoand other markets to the south was established in 1878.Marwil, p. 49Throughout the 1840s and the 1850s settlers continued to come to Ann Arbor. While the earlier settlers were primarily of British ancestry, the newer settlers also consisted of Germans, Irish,Marwil, p. 16and African-Americans.cite webhttp://moaa.aadl.org/moaa/pictorial_history/1824-1859pg61824–1859: Government and Growth. ''Pictorial History of Ann Arbor: 1824–1974''2006Ann Arbor District Library4 December 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20140221201558/http://moaa.aadl.org/moaa/pictorial_history/1824-1859pg62014-02-21In 1851, Ann Arbor was chartered as a city,cite bookState of MichiganPublic and Local Acts of the Legislature of the State of Michigan644though the city showed a drop in population during theLong DepressionDepression of 1873.It was not until the early 1880s that Ann Arbor again saw robust growth,cite webhttp://moaa.aadl.org/moaa/pictorial_history/1880-1899pg11880–1899: Setbacks and Renewed Growth. ''Pictorial History of Ann Arbor: 1824–1974''2006Ann Arbor District Library4 December 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20140221201620/http://moaa.aadl.org/moaa/pictorial_history/1880-1899pg12014-02-21with new immigrants coming from Greece, Italy, Russia, and Poland. Ann Arbor saw increased growth in manufacturing, particularly inMill (grinding)milling.cite webhttp://moaa.aadl.org/moaa/pictorial_history/1900-1919pg11900–1919: Population and Economic Growth. ''Pictorial History of Ann Arbor: 1824–1974''2006Ann Arbor District Library4 December 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20140221201609/http://moaa.aadl.org/moaa/pictorial_history/1900-1919pg12014-02-21Ann Arbor'sAmerican JewsJewishcommunity also grew after the turn of the 20th century, and its first and oldest synagogue,Beth Israel Congregation (Ann Arbor, Michigan)Beth Israel Congregation, was established in 1916., Beth Israel Congregation website, About Us. Retrieved 5 March 2013.

File:SouthU.jpgthumbalt=Tree-lined city street, with an apartment tower with columns of windows at the far-end of the streetSouth University Avenue caters to young people.During the 1960s and 1970s, the city gained a reputation as an important center for liberal politics. Ann Arbor also became a locus for left-wing activism and served as a hub for theAmerican civil rights movementcivil-rights movementandOpposition to U.S. involvement in the Vietnam Waranti-Vietnam War movement, as well as the student movement. The first major meetings of the national left-wing campus groupStudents for a Democratic Society (1960 organization)Students for a Democratic Societytook place in Ann Arbor in 1960; in 1965, the city was home to the first U.S.teach-inagainst theVietnam War.Marwil, p. 153During the ensuing 15 years, manycounterculturecounterculturalandNew Leftenterprises sprang up and developed large constituencies within the city.cite webhttp://moaa.aadl.org/moaa/pictorial_history/1940-1974pg31940–1974: From Protest to Outer Space. ''Pictorial History of Ann Arbor: 1824–1974''2006Ann Arbor District Library8 November 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20131110213004/http://moaa.aadl.org/moaa/pictorial_history/1940-1974pg32013-11-10These influences washed into municipal politics during the early and mid-1970s when three members of theHuman Rights Party (United States)Human Rights Party(HRP) won city council seats on the strength of the student vote. During their time on the council, HRP representatives fought for measures including pioneeringcivil rightsantidiscriminationordinances,Cannabis laws in Ann Arbor, Michiganmeasures decriminalizing marijuana possession, and arent controlrent-controlordinance;cite webRestivo, Terrence R.http://etd1.library.duq.edu/theses/available/etd-03312006-154729/unrestricted/RestivoThesis.pdfhttps://web.archive.org/web/20071201164218/http://etd1.library.duq.edu/theses/available/etd-03312006-154729/unrestricted/RestivoThesis.pdf1 December 2007The Building of a New Left Conglomerate in the City of Ann Arbor: VOICE, Action Movement and the Human Rights Party (1965–1975)PDF22 March 2006McAnulty College and Graduate School of Liberal Arts, Duquesne University23 August 2008many of these remain in effect in modified form. Alongside these liberal and left-wing efforts, a small group of conservative institutions were born in Ann Arbor. These includeWord of God (community)Word of God(established in 1967), aCharismatic Movementcharismaticinter-denominational movement;and theThomas More Law Center(established in 1999), a religious-conservative advocacy group.cite webhttp://www.thomasmore.org/qry/page.taf?idhttps://web.archive.org/web/20120117125839/http://www.thomasmore.org/qry/page.taf?id17 January 2012HistoryThomas More Law Center20095 March 2013

Following a 1956-vote, the city of East Ann Arbor merged with Ann Arbor to encompass the eastern sections of the city.cite webhttp://pittsfieldhistory.org/index.php?sectionInside the Eastside: History of East Ann Arbor, Michigan (MI)9 April 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20140323201545/http://pittsfieldhistory.org/index.php?section2014-03-23

In the past several decades, Ann Arbor has grappled with the effects of sharply rising land values,gentrification, andurban sprawlstretching into outlying countryside. On 4 November 2003, voters approved agreen beltgreenbeltplan under which the city government bought development rights on agricultural parcels of land adjacent to Ann Arbor to preserve them from sprawling development.cite webhttp://www.a2openspace.org/Ann Arbor Parks and Greenbelt Proposal2 March 2004Friends of Ann Arbor Open Space4 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20080723184116/http://www.a2openspace.org/23 July 2008noSince then, a vociferous local debate has hinged on how and whether to accommodate and guide development within city limits.cite journalhttp://www.mlive.com/news/ann-arbor/index.ssf/2009/05/ann_arbor_seeks_grants_for_gre.htmlAnn Arbor seeks grants for greenbelt landMcGovern, Judy18 May 2009The Ann Arbor News24 August 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20131110213245/http://www.mlive.com/news/ann-arbor/index.ssf/2009/05/ann_arbor_seeks_grants_for_gre.html2013-11-10Ann Arbor consistently ranks in the "top places to live" lists published by various mainstream media outlets every year. In 2008, it was ranked byCNNMoney.com27th out of 100 "America's best small cities".cite newshttp://money.cnn.com/magazines/moneymag/bplive/2008/top100/index2.htmlBest Places to Live—Money's List of America's Best Small CitiesCNNMoney.comAugust 200824 August 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20091005045948/http://money.cnn.com/magazines/moneymag/bplive/2008/top100/index2.html5 October 2009noAnd in the year 2010,Forbeslisted Ann Arbor as one of the most liveable cities in theUnited StatesUnited States of America.cite newshttp://www.forbes.com/2010/04/29/cities-livable-pittsburgh-lifestyle-real-estate-top-ten-jobs-crime-income_slide_8.htmlForbesFrancescaLevyAmerica's Most Livable Citieshttps://web.archive.org/web/20131110213537/http://www.forbes.com/2010/04/29/cities-livable-pittsburgh-lifestyle-real-estate-top-ten-jobs-crime-income_slide_8.html2013-11-10
article.heading: Geography and cityscape
article.paragraph: File:HuronRiverAnnArbor.JPGthumbrightThe Huron River runs through Ann ArborAccording to theUnited States Census Bureau, the city has a total area ofconvert28.70sqmisqkm2, of which,convert27.83sqmisqkm2of it is land andconvert0.87sqmisqkm2is water,cite webUS Gazetteer files 2010http://www.census.gov/geo/www/gazetteer/files/Gaz_places_national.txtUnited States Census Bureau25 November 2012http://www.webcitation.org/699nOulzi2012-07-14yesmuch of which is part of theHuron River (Michigan)Huron River. Ann Arbor is aboutconvert35mikmwest of Detroit.Ann Arbor Charter Township, MichiganAnn Arbor Charter Townshipadjoins the city's north and east sides. Ann Arbor is situated on theHuron River (Michigan)Huron Riverin a productive agricultural and fruit-growing region.cite book1911 Encyclopædia Britannicahttps://en.wikisource.org/wiki/1911_Encyclop%C3%A6dia_Britannica/Ann_ArborAnn Arbor2The landscape of Ann Arbor consists of hills and valleys, with the terrain becoming steeper near the Huron River. The elevation ranges from aboutconvert750ftmalong the Huron River toconvert1015ftmon the city's west side, near the intersection of Maple Road and Pauline Blvd.cite newsAnn Arbor NewsHow to Get Your Head in the CloudsGeoff LarcomAugust 30, 2004B-1Generally, the west-central and northwestern parts of the city and U-M's North Campus are the highest parts of the city; the lowest parts are along the Huron River and in the southeast.Ann Arbor Municipal Airport, which is south of the city atCoord4213.38N8344.74Wregion:US, has an elevation ofconvert839ftm.cite webhttp://www.airnav.com/airport/KARBKARB—Ann Arbor Municipal AirportFederal Aviation Administration at Airnav.com15 March 20074 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20080725153547/http://airnav.com/airport/KARB25 July 2008no

Ann Arbor's "Tree Town" nickname stems from the dense forestation of its parks and residential areas. The city contains more than 50,000 trees along its streets and an equal number in parks.cite webhttp://www.annarbor.org/aboutannarbor/funfacts.asphttps://web.archive.org/web/20060224212952/http://www.annarbor.org/aboutannarbor/funfacts.aspFun Facts2006Ann Arbor Area Convention and Visitor's Bureau24 February 200625 August 2009In recent years, theemerald ash borerhas destroyed many of the city's approximately 10,500ash trees.cite journalhttp://blog.mlive.com/annarbornews/2007/04/last_of_street_ash_trees_cut_d.htmlLast of street ash trees cut downThe Ann Arbor NewsDavis, Tracy2 April 200730 August 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20131110213017/http://blog.mlive.com/annarbornews/2007/04/last_of_street_ash_trees_cut_d.html2013-11-10The city contains 157 municipal parks ranging from small neighborhood green spots to large recreation areas. Several large city parks and a university park border sections of the Huron River.cite webhttp://www.a2gov.org/GOVERNMENT/COMMUNITYSERVICES/PARKSANDRECREATION/PARKS/Pages/Parks.aspxGeneral Parks InformationAnn Arbor City Government20096 September 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20131110223709/http://www.a2gov.org/government/communityservices/ParksandRecreation/parks/Pages/Parks.aspx2013-11-10Fuller Recreation Area, near theUniversity of Michigan Health SystemUniversity Hospitalcomplex, contains sports fields, pedestrian andbike paths, and swimming pools. TheNichols Arboretum, owned by theUniversity of Michigan, is aconvert123acrehaonarboretumthat contains hundreds of plant and tree species. It is on the city's east side, near the university's Central Campus.cite webhttp://www.michigan.org/Property/Detail.aspx?mNichols Arboretum—University of MichiganMichigan Economic Development Corporation (Michigan.org)200715 November 2007https://web.archive.org/web/20131110233649/http://www.michigan.org/property/detail.aspx?m2013-11-10Located across theHuron River (Michigan)Huron Riverjust beyond the university's North Campus is the university'sMatthaei Botanical Gardens, which contains 300 acres of gardens and a large tropical conservatory.

File:Ann anbor wshg st.jpgthumbleftalt=Night time in downtown, with buildings lit by street lampsWashington Street looking east to Main StreetThe Kerrytown Shops, Main Street Business District, the State Street Business District, and the South University Business District are commercial areas in downtown Ann Arbor. Three commercial areas south of downtown include the areas near I-94 and Ann Arbor-Saline Road,Briarwood Mall, and the South Industrial area. Other commercial areas include the Arborland/Washtenaw Avenue and Packard Road merchants on the east side, the Plymouth Road area in the northeast, and the Westgate/West Stadium areas on the west side.cite webhttp://www.a2gov.org/GOVERNMENT/COMMUNITYSERVICES/PLANNINGANDDEVELOPMENT/PLANNING/Pages/MasterPlans.aspxMaster Plans—General InformationAnn Arbor City Government200930 August 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20091006104724/http://www.a2gov.org/GOVERNMENT/COMMUNITYSERVICES/PLANNINGANDDEVELOPMENT/PLANNING/Pages/MasterPlans.aspx6 October 2009noDowntown contains a mix of 19th- and early-20th-century structures and modern-style buildings, as well as afarmers' marketin theKerrytownKerrytown district.cite webhttp://www.a2gov.org/CommunityServices/Parks/Farmers%20Market/farmers_main.htmlhttps://web.archive.org/web/20070518213203/http://www.a2gov.org/CommunityServices/Parks/Farmers+Market/farmers_main.html18 May 2007Ann Arbor Farmers' Market2007Ann Arbor City Government23 August 2008The city's commercial districts are composed mostly of two- to four-story structures, although downtown and the area near Briarwood Mall contain a small number of high-rise buildings.cite webhttp://www.a2gov.org/government/communityservices/planninganddevelopment/planning/Documents/Master%20Plans/DowntownPlan_May09_Final.pdfhttps://web.archive.org/web/20120302185253/http://www.a2gov.org/government/communityservices/planninganddevelopment/planning/Documents/Master%20Plans/DowntownPlan_May09_Final.pdf2 March 2012Downtown PlanAnn Arbor City Government20095 March 2013

Ann Arbor's residential neighborhoods contain architectural styles ranging from classic 19th-century and early-20th-century designs toranch-style houses. Among these homes are a number ofKit houses in Michigankit housesbuilt in the early 20th century. Contemporary-style houses are farther from the downtown district.Surrounding the University of Michigan campus are houses and apartment complexes occupied primarily by student renters.Tower Plaza, a 26-story condominium building located between the University of Michigan campus and downtown, is the tallest building in Ann Arbor.cite webhttp://www.emporis.com/en/wm/bu/?idTower Plaza, Ann ArborEmporis Buildings20074 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20071108180346/http://emporis.com/en/wm/bu/?id2007-11-08The 19th-century buildings and streetscape of the Old West Side neighborhood have been preserved virtually intact; in 1972, the district was listed on theNational Register of Historic Places, and it is further protected by city ordinances and a nonprofit preservation group.cite webhttp://www.oldwestside.org/Neighborhood AssociationOld West Side Association20074 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20140323135335/http://www.oldwestside.org/2014-03-23

template.arg: City skyline during the day with clear skies

Ann Arbor skyline looking northeast from [[Michigan Stadium]]. From left to right several Ann Arbor landmarks may be seen: The [[Tower Plaza (Ann Arbor, Michigan)|Tower Plaza]] condominium building, the tallest building in Ann Arbor; the [[Burton Memorial Tower]] on the Central Campus of the University of Michigan, a [[clock tower]] and [[carillon]]; the [[Michigan Union]] (flying a maize-and-blue flag); and the Central Power Plant, operated by the university. The [[Modern architecture]] building on the far right is the [[Stephen M. Ross School of Business]].

article.heading: Climate
article.paragraph: climate chartAnn Arbor, Michigan 17.931.22.59 19.934.92.4 27.245.92.66 3859.63.25 48.270.63.42 57.979.73.68 62.183.23.61 61.181.23.69 53.474.23.45 42.461.42.83 3347.93.09 2334.92.89 right both imperial Ann Arbor has a typicallyMidwestern United StatesMidwesternhumid continental climate(Kppen climate classificationKppenDfa), which is influenced by theGreat Lakes. There are four distinct seasons: winters are cold with moderate to heavy snowfall, while summers are very warm and humid; in between, spring and autumn are short but mild. The area experienceslake effectweather, primarily in the form of increased cloudiness during late fall and early winter.cite webhttp://www.washtenawcd.org/about/2006resourceassess.pdfWashtenaw County Resource AssessmentSeptember 2006Washtenaw County Conservation DistrictPDF1 November 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20120305122233/http://www.washtenawcd.org/about/2006resourceassess.pdf2012-03-05The monthly daily average temperature in July isconvert72.6°F1, while the same figure for January isconvert24.5°F1. Temperatures reach or exceedconvert90°F0on 10 days,and drop to or belowconvert0°F0on 4.6 nights.Precipitation tends to be the heaviest during the summer months, but most frequent during winter. Snowfall, which normally occurs from November to April but occasionally starts in October, averagesconvert58incm0per season. The lowest recorded temperature wasconvert-23°F0on 11 February 1885 and the highest recorded temperature wasconvert105°F0on 24 July 1934.
article.heading: Demographics
article.paragraph: As of the 2010 U.S. Census, there were 113,394 people, 45,634 households, and 21,704 families residing in the city. The population density was 4,270.33 people per square mile (2653.47/km). There were 49,982 housing units at an average density of 1,748.0 per square mile (675.0/km), making it less densely populated than inner-ring Detroit suburbs likeOak Park, MichiganOak ParkandFerndale, MichiganFerndale(and than Detroit proper), but more densely populated than outer-ring suburbs likeLivonia, MichiganLivoniaorTroy, MichiganTroy. The racial makeup of the city was 73.0%White (U.S. Census)White(70.4% non-Hispanic White), 7.7%Race and ethnicity in the United States CensusBlack or African American, 0.3%Race and ethnicity in the United States CensusNative American, 14.4%Race and ethnicity in the United States CensusAsian, 0.0%Race and ethnicity in the United States CensusPacific Islander, 1.0% fromRace and ethnicity in the United States Censusother races, and 3.6% from two or more races.Race and ethnicity in the United States CensusHispanicorRace and ethnicity in the United States CensusLatinoresidents of any race were 4.1% of the population.cite webhttp://quickfacts.census.gov/qfd/states/26/2603000.htmlAnn Arbor (city), Michigan2010U.S. Census Bureau4 August 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20131020081524/http://quickfacts.census.gov:80/qfd/states/26/2603000.html2013-10-20
In 2010 there was a total of 45,166 households, with an average of 2.51 persons per household.

As of 2000 the ancestry reports collected by the US census showed that in Ann Arbor 14.9% were ofGermansGerman, 8.5% English and 7.9% Irish ancestry according toCensus 2000. 79.2% spoke onlyEnglish languageEnglishat home, while 3.2% spoke Chinese orStandard MandarinMandarin, 3.1% Spanish, 1.9%Korean languageKorean, 1.2%German languageGerman, 1.1%Japanese languageJapaneseand 1.0%French languageFrench. Because of the pull of the university, the city has one of the highest foreign-born populations in the state, at 17.4%.cite webAnn Arbor city, Michigan fact sheet2000U.S. Census Bureau21 May 2010http://factfinder2.census.gov/faces/tableservices/jsf/pages/productview.xhtml?pidfailed verificationAugust 2015

In 2013, Ann Arbor had the second-largest community ofJapanese peopleJapanesecitizens in the state of Michigan, numbering 1,541; this figure trailed only that ofNovi, MichiganNovi, which had 2,666 Japanese nationals.Stone, Cal. "State's Japanese employees increasing." (Archive)Observer & Eccentric.Gannett Company. 11 April 2013. Retrieved on 5 May 2013.

File:Ann Arbor Property Crime Statistics, 2004.svgthumbleftAnn Arbor Property Crime Statistics, 2004In 2000, out of 45,693 households, 23.0% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 37.8% were married couples living together, 7.5% had a female householder with no husband present, and 52.5% were nonfamilies. 35.5% of households were made up of individuals and 6.6% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.22 and the average family size was 2.90. The age distribution was 16.8% under 18, 26.8% from 18 to 24, 31.2% from 25 to 44, 17.3% from 45 to 64, and 7.9% were 65 or older. The median age was 28 years. For every 100 females there were 97.7 males; while for every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 96.4 males.

The median income for a household in the city was $46,299, and the median income for a family was $71,293 (these figures had risen to $51,232 and $82,293 respectively as of a 2007 estimate).cite webhttp://factfinder.census.gov/servlet/ACSSAFFFacts?_eventAnn Arbor city, Michigan, 2006–2008 American Community Survey 3-Year EstimatesUnited States Census Bureau20094 December 2009Males had a median income of $48,880 versus $36,561 for females. The per capita income for the city was $26,419. About 4.6% of families and 16.6% of the population were below the poverty line, including 7.3% of those under age 18 and 5.1% of those age 65 or over.

Ann Arbor's crime rate was below the national average in 2000. The violent crime rate was further below the national average than the property crime rate; the two rates were 48% and 11% lower than the U.S. average, respectively.cite webhttp://www.fedstats.gov/qf/states/26/2603000.htmlAnn Arbor city, Michigan – MapStatsFedStats24 October 20064 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20080830055844/http://www.fedstats.gov/qf/states/26/2603000.html30 August 2008nocite webhttp://bjsdata.ojp.usdoj.gov/dataonline/Search/Crime/State/statebystaterun.cfm?stateidReported crime in United States-Total[[U.S. Department of Justice]] Office of Justice Programs – Bureau of Justice Statistics13 December 20064 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20110721071912/http://bjsdata.ojp.usdoj.gov/dataonline/Search/Crime/State/statebystaterun.cfm?stateid2011-07-21
article.heading: Economy
article.paragraph: The University of Michigan shapes Ann Arbor's economy significantly. It employs about 30,000 workers, including about 12,000 in the medical center.cite newshttp://money.usnews.com/money/retirement/best-places-to-retire/michigan/ann_arborhttps://web.archive.org/web/20120101184700/http://money.usnews.com/money/retirement/best-places-to-retire/michigan/ann_arbor1 January 2012Ann Arbor, MIU.S. News & World Report20105 March 2013Other employers are drawn to the area by the university's research and development money, and by its graduates.High tech, health services andbiotechnologyare other major components of the city's economy; numerous medical offices, laboratories, and associated companies are located in the city.Automobile industryAutomobile manufacturers, such asGeneral Motors CorporationGeneral MotorsandVisteon, also employ residents.

link.part: alt=Atrium of a shopping arcade, with green and yellow banners hanging overhead with the words "Nickels Arcade"
Nickels Arcade interior, looking towards the east

article.paragraph: High tech companies have located in the area since the 1930s, whenInternational Radio Corporationintroduced the first mass-produced AC/DC radio (the Kadette, in 1931) as well as the first pocket radio (the Kadette Jr., in 1933).cite journalMahon, Morgan E.A Flick of the Switch 1930–1950Antiques Electronics Supply1990100–1TheArgus (camera company)Argus camera company, originally a subsidiary of International Radio, manufactured cameras in Ann Arbor from 1936 to the 1960s. Current firms includeArbor Networks(provider of Internet traffic engineering and security systems),Arbortext(provider of XML-based publishing software),JSTOR(the digital scholarly journal archive), MediaSpan (provider of software and online services for the media industries),Truven Health Analytics, andProQuest, which includesUniversity Microfilms InternationalUMI.cite webhttp://www.proquest.com/en-US/aboutus/contactus.shtmlContact UsProQuest200923 August 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20131010080055/http://www.proquest.com:80/en-US/aboutus/contactus.shtml2013-10-10Ann Arbor Terminals manufactured a video-display terminal called the Ann Arbor Ambassador during the 1980s.cite journalInfoNews/HardwareInfoWorld1 February 198243Barracuda Networks, which provides networking, security, and storage products based on network appliances and cloud services, opened an engineering office in Ann Arbor in 2008 on Depot St.cite webMartinMikeBarracuda Networks moves into 201 Depot Street in Ann Arborhttp://www.concentratemedia.com/devnews/201depotannarbor0027.aspxConcentrate Media29 June 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20131110233821/http://www.concentratemedia.com/devnews/201depotannarbor0027.aspx2013-11-10and recently announced it will move downtown to occupy the building previously used as theBorders BooksBordersheadquarters.cite webAlfsLizzyBarracuda Networks signs deal to move hundreds of jobs to ex-Borders offices in downtown Ann Arborhttp://annarbor.com/business-review/barracuda-networks-bringing-hundreds-of-jobs-to-ex-borders-building-in-downtown-ann-arbor/AnnArbor.com29 June 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20131110232925/http://annarbor.com/business-review/barracuda-networks-bringing-hundreds-of-jobs-to-ex-borders-building-in-downtown-ann-arbor/2013-11-10

Websites and online media companies in or near the city includeAll Media Guide, theWeather Underground (weather service)Weather Underground, andZattoo. Ann Arbor is the home toInternet2and theMerit Network, a not-for-profit research and education computer network. Both are located in the South State Commons 2 building on South State Street, which once housed the Michigan Information Technology Center Foundation.cite newsBomey, Nathanhttp://www.annarbor.com/business-review/mitc-foundation-to-dissolve-after-losing-46-million-in-3-year-stretch/Michigan Information Technology Center dissolving after Ann Arbor nonprofit lost $4.6M over 3 yearsBusiness ReviewAnnArbor.com29 August 201019 October 2014https://web.archive.org/web/20131110214107/http://www.annarbor.com/business-review/mitc-foundation-to-dissolve-after-losing-46-million-in-3-year-stretch/2013-11-10The city is also home to the headquarters of Google'sAdWordsprogramthe company's primary revenue stream.cite journalGoodman, David N.http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2006/07/11/AR2006071100225.htmlGoogle Plans to Open Facility in Michigan11 July 2006The Washington Post4 August 2008The recent surge in companies operating in Ann Arbor has led to a decrease in its office and flex space vacancy rates. As of 31 December 2012, the total market vacancy rate for office and flex space is 11.80%, a 1.40% decrease in vacancy from one year previous, and the lowest overall vacancy level since 2003. The office vacancy rate decreased to 10.65% in 2012 from 12.08% in 2011, while the flex vacancy rate decreased slightly more, with a drop from 16.50% to 15.02%.cite webSwisher Commercial's Annual Ann Arbor Office/Flex Space Vacancy Report-2012http://www.swishercommercial.com/vacancy-reportSwisher Commercial28 April 2013https://web.archive.org/web/20131110212913/http://www.swishercommercial.com/vacancy-report2013-11-10

File:TowerPlaza45.JPGthumbleftuprightalt=Tower with blue glass facade and white concrete sides, and a framed communication mast at the topTower Plaza, Ann Arbor's tallest buildingPfizer, once the city's second largest employer, operated a large pharmaceutical research facility on the northeast side of Ann Arbor. On 22 January 2007, Pfizer announced it would close operations in Ann Arbor by the end of 2008.cite journalhttp://blog.mlive.com/annarbornews/breaking_news/pfizer/One year later: Pfizer labs emptying outStefanie Murray19 January 2008The Ann Arbor News25 August 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20091006051805/http://blog.mlive.com/annarbornews/breaking_news/pfizer/6 October 2009noThe facility was previously operated byWarner-Lambertand, before that,Parke-Davis. In December 2008, the University of Michigan Board of Regents approved the purchase of the facilities, and the university anticipates hiring 2,000 researchers and staff during the next 10 years.cite newshttp://ns.umich.edu/htdocs/releases/story.php?idU-M to buy Pfizer's former Ann Arbor propertyUniversity of Michigan News Service18 December 200819 October 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20100609213216/http://www.ns.umich.edu/htdocs/releases/story.php?id2010-06-09The city is the home of other research and engineering centers, including those ofLotus CarsLotus Engineering,General Dynamicsand theNational Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration(NOAA). Other research centers sited in the city are theUnited States Environmental Protection Agency's National Vehicle and Fuel Emissions Laboratorycite webhttp://www.epa.gov/nvfel/National Vehicle and Fuel Emissions Laboratory3 April 2007[[United States Environmental Protection Agency]]23 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20080920012129/http://www.epa.gov/nvfel/20 September 2008noand theToyotaToyota Technical Center.cite webhttp://www.toyota.com/about/our_business/research_and_development/Our Business—Research & Development2010Toyota Motor North America, Inc19 October 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20101006010026/http://www.toyota.com/about/our_business/research_and_development/6 October 2010noThe city is also home to National Sanitation Foundation International (NSF International), the nonprofit non-governmental organization that develops generally accepted standards for a variety of public health related industries and subject areas.cite journalhttp://blog.mlive.com/ann_arbor_business_review/2007/11/company_of_2007_nsf_internatio.htmlCompany of 2007: NSF InternationalNathan Bomey and Greg MiglioreAnn Arbor Business Review15 November 20076 September 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20131110213246/http://blog.mlive.com/ann_arbor_business_review/2007/11/company_of_2007_nsf_internatio.html2013-11-10

Borders Books, started in Ann Arbor, was opened by brothers Tom and Louis Borders in 1971 with a stock of used books. The Borders chain was based in the city, as was its flagship store until it closed in September 2011.cite webDolan, Matthew21 July 2011http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052702303661904576455913644424424.htmlLamenting Borders' Death at 'Store No. 1'The Wall Street Journal5 March 2013https://web.archive.org/web/20110722033914/http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052702303661904576455913644424424.html2011-07-22Domino's Pizza's headquarters is near Ann Arbor on Domino's Farms, aconvert271acrehaonFrank Lloyd Wright-inspired complex just northeast of the city.cite journalhttp://blog.mlive.com/ann_arbor_business_review/2007/11/commercial_real_estate_winner.htmlCommercial Real Estate winner: Domino's FarmsMigliore, GregAnn Arbor Business Review15 November 20076 September 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20131104205755/http://blog.mlive.com/ann_arbor_business_review/2007/11/commercial_real_estate_winner.html2013-11-04Another Ann Arbor-based company isZingerman'sZingerman's Delicatessen, which serves sandwiches and has developed businesses under a variety of brand names. Zingerman's has grown into a family of companies which offers a variety of products (bake shop, mail order, creamery, coffee) and services (business education).cite journalhttp://www.mlive.com/business/grpress/index.ssf?/base/business-6/1220298310172420.xml&collZingerman's recipe for success will be servedAlbanese, ErinThe Grand Rapids Press1 September 20086 September 2009Flint Ink Corp., another Ann Arbor-based company, was the world's largest privately held ink manufacturer until it was acquired by Stuttgart-based XSYS Print Solutions in October 2005.cite webhttp://www.flintgrp.com/FlintGroupPressRelease.nsf/0/49F3D7414F165D04852571BF005D9867?OpenDocumenthttps://web.archive.org/web/20071020023945/http://flintgrp.com/FlintGroupPressRelease.nsf/0/49F3D7414F165D04852571BF005D9867?OpenDocument20 October 2007Flint Ink and XSYS Print Solutions Agree to MergeFlint Group20 July 200523 August 2008Avfuel, a global supplier of aviation fuels and services, is also headquartered in Ann Arbor.cite journalhttp://blog.mlive.com/ann_arbor_business_review/2008/04/aviation_fuel_co_plans_ann_arb.htmlAviation fuel co. plans Ann Arbor HQ expansionMeisler, DanAnn Arbor Business Review18 April 20086 September 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20131104201458/http://blog.mlive.com/ann_arbor_business_review/2008/04/aviation_fuel_co_plans_ann_arb.html2013-11-04Aastrom Biosciences, a publicly traded company that develops stem cell treatments for cardiovascular diseases, is headquartered in Ann Arbor.cite webhttp://www.aastrom.com/about-aastrom/About Aastrom Biosciences – Stem Cell Therapeuticshttps://web.archive.org/web/20131025023905/http://www.aastrom.com:80/about-aastrom/2013-10-25

Manycooperativescooperativeenterprises were founded in the city; among those that remain are the People's Food Co-op and theInter-Cooperative Council at the University of Michigan, astudent housing cooperativefounded in 1937.cite webhttp://www.icc.coop/learn/history/About ICC—Inter-Cooperative Council2007Inter-Cooperative Council, Ann Arbor, MI, U.S.A.4 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20080624064519/http://www.icc.coop/learn/history/24 June 2008There are also threecohousingcommunitiesSunward CohousingSunward, Great Oak, and Touchstonelocated immediately to the west of the city limits.cite webhttp://directory.ic.org/intentional_communities_in_MichiganCommunities DirectoryFellowship for Intentional Community201019 October 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20131110214425/http://directory.ic.org/intentional_communities_in_Michigan2013-11-10
article.heading: Culture
article.paragraph: MainCulture in Ann Arbor, MichiganSeveral performing arts groups and facilities are on the University of Michigan's campus, as areMuseums at the University of Michiganmuseumsdedicated to art,archaeology, and natural history and sciences. Founded in 1879, theUniversity Musical Societyis an independent performing arts organization that presents over 60 events each year, bringing international artists in music, dance, and theater. Since 2001Shakespeare in the Arbhas presented one play by Shakespeare each June, in a large park near downtown.http://mbgna.blogspot.com/2015/04/shakespeare-in-arb-fifteen-years-of.htmlRegional and local performing arts groups not associated with the university include the Ann Arbor Civic Theatre, the Arbor Opera Theater, theAnn Arbor Symphony Orchestra, the Ann Arbor Ballet Theater, the Ann Arbor Civic Ballet (established in 1954 as Michigan's first chartered ballet company),cite webhttp://www.sylviastudio.com/civic.htmAnn Arbor Civic BalletSylvia Studio of Dance – Ann Arbor Civic Ballet20096 September 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20140501152058/http://www.sylviastudio.com/civic.htm2014-05-01The Ark (folk venue)The Ark, andPerformance Network Theatre.cite webhttp://www.performancenetwork.org/about-us/AboutPerformance Network Theatre200923 August 2009Another unique piece of artistic expression in Ann Arbor is theFairy Doors of Ann Arbor, MIfairy doors. These small portals are examples ofinstallation artand can be found throughout the downtown area.cite webHeadlee, Celestehttp://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyIdThe Wee Fairy Doors of Ann Arbor, Mich.NPR9 May 20064 August 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20140323134324/http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId2014-03-23

TheAnn Arbor Hands-On Museumis located in a renovated and expanded historic downtown fire station. Multiple art galleries exist in the city, notably in the downtown area and around the University of Michigan campus. Aside from a large restaurant scene in the Main Street, South State Street, and South University Avenue areas, Ann Arbor ranks first among U.S. cities in the number of booksellers and books sold per capita.cite webhttp://ecurrent.com/ag/2003/shop/list.php#booAnn Arbor Guide 2003–42003–2004Ecurrent.com4 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20041210170216/http://ecurrent.com/ag/2003/shop/list.php#boo10 December 2004TheAnn Arbor District Librarymaintains four branch outlets in addition to its main downtown building. The city is also home to theGerald R. Ford Presidential Library.cite webhttp://www.fordlibrarymuseum.gov/library/aboutlib.aspGerald R. Ford Presidential Library and MuseumPresidential Libraries System – National Archives and Records Administration13 August 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090825083415/http://www.fordlibrarymuseum.gov/library/aboutlib.asp25 August 2009no

Several annual eventsmany of them centered on performing and visual artsdraw visitors to Ann Arbor. One such event is theAnn Arbor Art Fairs, a set of four concurrent juried fairs held on downtown streets. Scheduled on Wednesday through Saturday of the third week of July, the fairs draw upward of half a million visitors.cite webhttp://www.artfair.org/About—Mission & HistoryAnn Arbor Street Art Fair20064 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20140410121649/http://artfair.org/2014-04-10Another is theAnn Arbor Film Festival, held during the third week of March, which receives more than 2,500 submissions annually from more than 40 countries and serves as one of a handful of Academy Awardqualifying festivals in the United States.cite webAbouthttp://www.aafilmfest.org/about/Ann Arbor Film Festival31 May 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090621095019/http://www.aafilmfest.org/about/21 June 2009no

Ann Arbor has a long history of openness to marijuana, given Ann Arbor's decriminalization ofcannabis (drug)cannabis, the large number of medical marijuana dispensaries in the city (one dispensary, called People's Co-op, was directly across the street fromMichigan Stadiumuntil zoning forced it to move one mile to the west), the large number of pro-marijuana residents, and the annualHash Bash: an event that is held on the first Saturday of April. Until (at least) the successful passage of Michigan's medical marijuana law, the event had arguably strayed from its initial intent, although for years, a number of attendees have received serious legal responses due to marijuana use on University of Michigan property, which does not fall under the City's progressive and compassionate ticketing program.cite webhttp://www.annarbor.com/news/40-years-of-hash-bash-marijuana-festival-that-started-in-early-1970s-still-going-strong-in-ann-arbor/#.UB0h48gSRbM40 years of Hash Bash: Marijuana festival started in 1972 in Ann Arbor stands test of timeAnn Arbor.com31 March 20114 August 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20131231055000/http://www.annarbor.com/news/40-years-of-hash-bash-marijuana-festival-that-started-in-early-1970s-still-going-strong-in-ann-arbor/2013-12-31

File:Michigan Stadium 2011.jpgthumbleftMichigan StadiumAnn Arbor is a major scene of college sports, most notably at the University of Michigan, a member of theBig Ten Conference. Several well-known college sports facilities exist in the city, includingMichigan Stadium, the largestAmerican footballstadium in the worldcite journalBattle over Michigan Stadium has national implicationsSchultz, MarisaThe Detroit News24 December 2007with a 107,601 seating capacity.The stadium is colloquially known as "The Big House".cite webhttp://www.mgoblue.com/facilities/michigan-stadium.htmlMichigan StadiumMGoBlue.com5 June 200923 August 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20140419162602/http://www.mgoblue.com/facilities/michigan-stadium.html2014-04-19Crisler CenterandYost Ice Arenaplay host to the school's basketball (bothMichigan Wolverines men's basketballmen'sandMichigan Wolverines women's basketballwomen's) andMichigan Wolverines men's ice hockeyice hockeyteams, respectively.cite webhttp://www.mgoblue.com/facilities/page.aspx?idhttps://web.archive.org/web/20080530195324/http://www.mgoblue.com/facilities/page.aspx?id30 May 2008University of Michigan Athletics FacilitiesMGoBlue.com200923 August 2009Concordia University, Ann Arbor, MichiganConcordia University, a member of theNational Association of Intercollegiate AthleticsNAIA, also fields sports teams.cite webhttp://www.concordiacardinals.com/index.phpConcordia University AthleticsConcordia University—Ann Arbor, Michigan200923 August 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20131110212641/http://www.concordiacardinals.com/index.php2013-11-10

A person from Ann Arbor is called an "Ann Arborite", and many long-time residents call themselves "townies". The city itself is often called "A" ("A-squared") or "A2" ("A two") or "AA", "The Deuce" (mainly by Chicagoans), and "Tree Town".cite webhttp://www.ssw.umich.edu/about/UM-A2.htmlAbout U-M SSW—Ann ArborUniversity of Michigan School of Social Work200924 August 2009Withtongue-in-cheekreference to the city's liberal political leanings, some occasionally refer to Ann Arbor as "The People's Republic of Ann Arbor"cite newsBakopoulos, Deanhttp://www.pub.umich.edu/daily/1997/apr/04-17-97/week/arts21.htmlhttps://web.archive.org/web/20080102004715/http://www.pub.umich.edu/daily/1997/apr/04-17-97/week/arts21.html2 January 2008Places I'll remember: A farewell to Ann ArborThe Michigan Daily17 April 199729 August 2010or "25 square miles surrounded by reality",cite webhttp://www.boothnewspapers.com/markets/aa.htmlhttps://web.archive.org/web/20060621195124/http://www.boothnewspapers.com/markets/aa.html21 June 2006Welcome to Ann ArborBooth Newspapers – ''The Ann Arbor News''20074 August 2008the latter phrase being adapted from Wisconsin GovernorLee Dreyfus's description ofMadison, Wisconsin. InA Prairie Home Companionbroadcast from Ann Arbor,Garrison Keillordescribed Ann Arbor as "a city where people discuss socialism, but only in the fanciest restaurants." Ann Arbor sometimes appears oncitation indexesas an author, instead of a location, often with theacademic degreeMI, a misunderstanding of the abbreviation for Michigan.cite journalPostellon DCHall and Keynes join Arbor in the citation indexes[[Nature (journal)|Nature]]4527185282March 20081835445710.1038/452282bAnn Arbor has become increasingly gentrified in recent years.
article.heading: Law and government
article.paragraph: See alsoList of mayors of Ann Arbor, MichiganFile:AACityHall.JPGthumbalt=A modern white building with about 5 stories, with a brick center towerThe Guy C. Larcom, Jr. Municipal Building housed the city hall and police station. It is in the process of major renovations, including a new adjacent and connected structure that will become the new face of city hall.Ann Arbor has aCouncilmanager governmentcouncil-managerform of government. The City Council has 11 voting members: the mayor and 10 city council members. The mayor and city council members serve two-year terms: the mayor is elected every even-numbered year, while half of the city council members are up for election annually (five in even-numbered and five in odd-numbered years). Two council members are elected from each of the city's five wards. The mayor is elected citywide. The mayor is the presiding officer of the City Council and has the power to appoint all Council committee members as well as board and commission members, with the approval of the City Council. The current mayor of Ann Arbor isChristopher Taylor (politician)Christopher Taylor, aDemocratic Party (United States)Democratwho was elected as mayor in 2014.cite webhttp://www.a2gov.org/departments/city-council/Pages/Mayor-Christopher-Taylor.aspxhttps://web.archive.org/web/20070513001747/http://www.a2gov.org/citycouncil/index.html13 May 2007Government2007Ann Arbor City Council23 August 2008Day-to-day city operations are managed by aCity managercity administratorchosen by the city council.cite webhttp://www.a2gov.org/government/city_administration/City_Clerk/Documents/charter.pdfhttps://web.archive.org/web/20111003030858/http://www.a2gov.org/government/city_administration/City_Clerk/Documents/charter.pdf3 October 2011Charter for the City of Ann Arbor, MichiganAnn Arbor City Government9 April 19565 March 2013PDF9, 41

In 1960, Ann Arbor voters approved a $2.3 millionBond (finance)bond issueto build the current city hall, which was designed by architectAlden B. Dow. The City Hall opened in 1963. In 1995, the building was renamed the Guy C. Larcom, Jr. Municipal Building in honor of the longtime city administrator who championed the building's construction.cite webhttp://www.annarbor.com/news/guy-larcoms-name-peeled-from-exterior-of-city-hall-but-building-will-remain-named-in-his-honor/Guy Larcom's name peeled from exterior of city hall, but building will remain named in his honorAnnarbor.com14 April 201121 April 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20140323134619/http://www.annarbor.com/news/guy-larcoms-name-peeled-from-exterior-of-city-hall-but-building-will-remain-named-in-his-honor/2014-03-23

Ann Arbor is part ofMichigan's 12th congressional district, represented inUnited States CongressCongressbyUnited States House of RepresentativesRepresentativeDebbie Dingell, a Democrat. On the state level, the city is part of the 18th district in theMichigan Senate, represented by DemocratRebekah Warren. In theMichigan House of Representatives, representation is split between the 55th district (northern Ann Arbor, part of Ann Arbor Township, and other surrounding areas, represented by DemocratAdam Zemke), the 53rd district (most of downtown and the southern half of the city, represented by DemocratJeff Irwin) and the 52nd district (southwestern areas outside Ann Arbor proper and western Washtenaw County, represented by DemocratGretchen Driskell).cite webhttp://www.arborweb.com/govtindex.htmlAnn Arbor Government GuideArborweb.com20074 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20090106035620/http://arborweb.com/govtindex.html2009-01-06cite webhttp://www.house.mi.gov/mhrpublic/Michigan House of Representatives: Find A Representativehttps://web.archive.org/web/20140411000209/http://www.house.mi.gov/mhrpublic/2014-04-11

As thecounty seatofWashtenaw County, MichiganWashtenaw County, the Washtenaw County Trial Court (22nd Circuit Court) is located in Ann Arbor at the Washtenaw County Courthouse on Main Street. This court has countywidegeneral jurisdictionand has two divisions: The Civil/Criminal (Criminal lawcriminalandCivil law (common law)civil matters) and the Family Division (which includesJuvenile Court,Guardian ad litemFriend of the Court, andProbate Courtsections). Seven judges serve on the court.cite webhttp://washtenawtrialcourt.org/WASHTENAW COUNTY TRIAL COURT – Washtenaw County Trial CourtWashtenawtrialcourt.org20 February 201221 April 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20140323140232/http://washtenawtrialcourt.org/2014-03-23

Ann Arbor also has a local state district court (15th District Court), which serves only the City of Ann Arbor. In Michigan, the state district courts arelimited jurisdictioncourts which handletraffic violations, civil cases with claims under $25,000,Landlordtenant lawlandlord-tenantmatters, andmisdemeanorcrimes.The other areas of Washtenaw County are served by other district courts: District 14-B court serves theYpsilanti Township, MichiganCharter Township of Ypsilanti, District 14-A, based in theYpsilanti, MichiganCity of Ypsilanti, serves all other areas of Washtenaw County.

The Ann Arbor Federal Building (attached to a post office) on Liberty Street serves as one of thecourthousesfor theUnited States District Court for the Eastern District of MichiganU.S. District Court for the Eastern District of MichiganandUnited States Court of Appeals for the Sixth CircuitCourt of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit.cite webhttp://www.aadl.org/node/5049The Ugliest Building in Ann Arbor? | Ann Arbor District LibraryAadl.org21 April 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20131110221027/http://www.aadl.org/node/50492013-11-10cite webWednesday, 8 April 2009http://www.concentratemedia.com/devnews/annarborfederalbuilding0051.aspxDowntown Ann Arbor’s Federal Building in line for green upgradesConcentratemedia.com8 April 200921 April 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20131110215301/http://www.concentratemedia.com/devnews/annarborfederalbuilding0051.aspx2013-11-10cite webhttp://www.mied.uscourts.gov/Visiting/Locations/Locations, Driving Directions, ParkingUnited States District Court – Eastern District of Michigan200923 August 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090825160412/http://www.mied.uscourts.gov/Visiting/Locations/25 August 2009nocite webhttps://web.archive.org/web/20120222105240/http://www.ca6.uscourts.gov/lib_hist/Courthouses/michigan/annarbor.htmlAnn Arbor courthouseWeb.archive.org22 February 201229 June 2013
article.heading: Politics
article.paragraph: Left-wing politics have been particularly strong in municipal government since the 1960s. Voters approved charter amendments that haveCannabis laws in Ann Arbor, Michiganlessened the penaltiesfor possession of marijuana (1974),cite journalAnn Arbor Votes $5 Fine for the Use of MarijuanaThe New York Times3 April 197410and that aim to protect access to abortion in the city should it ever become illegal in the State of Michigan (1990).cite journalMarshall, SteveCity Hopes to Thwart Michigan on Abortion LawUSA Today14 February 19903AIn 1974,Kathy Kozachenko's victory in an Ann Arbor city-council race made her the country's first openly homosexual candidate to win public office.cite journalCohen-Vrignaud, Gerardhttp://www.pub.umich.edu/daily/1999/feb/02-12-99/news/news18.htmlGay and ProudThe Michigan Daily12 February 19994 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20080103130053/http://www.pub.umich.edu/daily/1999/feb/02-12-99/news/news18.html3 January 2008In 1975, Ann Arbor became the first U.S. city to useinstant-runoff votingfor a mayoral race. Adopted through a ballot initiative sponsored by the localHuman Rights Party (United States)Human Rights Party, which feared a splintering of the liberal vote, the process was repealed in 1976 after use in only one election.cite webWalter, Benjaminhttp://migreens.org/hvgreens/aa-irv01.htmInstant Runoff Voting (IRV)—History of Use in Ann Arbor26 August 2001Green Party of Michigan4 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20080917220033/http://migreens.org/hvgreens/aa-irv01.htm17 September 2008noAs of August 2009,Democratic Party (United States)Democratshold the mayorship and all council seats.cite webhttp://www.a2gov.org/government/citycouncil/Pages/Home.aspxGovernment – City CouncilAnn Arbor City Government200924 August 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20131110220041/http://www.a2gov.org/government/citycouncil/Pages/Home.aspx2013-11-10TheLeftright politicsleft tiltof politics in the city has earned it the nickname "ThePeople's Republicof Ann Arbor".cite webhttp://arborwiki.org/city/The_People%27s_Republic_of_Ann_ArborThe People's Republic of Ann ArborArborWiki201013 May 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20100505154845/http://arborwiki.org/city/The_People%27s_Republic_of_Ann_Arbor5 May 2010noNationally, Ann Arbor is located inMichigan's 12th congressional district, represented byDemocratic Party (United States)DemocratDebbie Dingell.
article.heading: Education
Higher education
article.paragraph: File:Law School Facade 2009.JPGthumbUniversity of Michigan Law SchoolLegal Research Building.TheUniversity of Michigandominates the city of Ann Arbor, providing the city with its distinctivecollege towncollege-towncharacter.cite journalCochran, JasonOctober 2002https://web.archive.org/liveweb/http://www.budgettravel.com/feature/0210_CollegeTown_AnnArbor,4274/Ann Arbor, MichiganBudget Travel Online5 March 2013

Other local colleges and universities includeConcordia University Ann Arbor, aLutheran ChurchMissouri SynodLutheranliberal-arts institution; a campus of theUniversity of Phoenix; andCleary University, a private business school.Washtenaw Community Collegeis located in neighboringAnn Arbor Township. In 2000, theAve Maria School of Law, a Roman Catholic law school established byDomino's PizzafounderTom Monaghan, opened in northeastern Ann Arbor, but the school moved toAve Maria, Floridain 2009,cite journalBrannock, Jenniferhttp://www.naplesnews.com/news/2007/feb/25/florida_vs_michigan_ave_maria_law_school_not_game_/Florida vs. Michigan: Ave Maria law school not a game to themNaples Daily News25 February 20074 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20130613173843/http://www.naplesnews.com/news/2007/feb/25/florida_vs_michigan_ave_maria_law_school_not_game_/2013-06-13and theThomas M. Cooley Law Schoolacquired the former Ave Maria buildings for use as a branch campus.cite webPaula Gardnerhttp://blog.mlive.com/paulagardner/2009/06/cooley_law_move_into_ave_maria.htmlCooley Law move into Ave Maria space good news for office real estate market | MLive.comBlog.mlive.com21 April 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20140323135348/http://blog.mlive.com/paulagardner/2009/06/cooley_law_move_into_ave_maria.html2014-03-23cite webhttp://www.nationaljurist.com/content/thomas-cooley-opens-new-branch-old-ave-maria-buildingThomas Cooley opens new branch in old Ave Maria buildingthe National Jurist21 April 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20140323134622/http://www.nationaljurist.com/content/thomas-cooley-opens-new-branch-old-ave-maria-building2014-03-23cite webhttp://www.annarbor.com/business-review/law-schools-lease-of-former-ave-maria-site-keeps-area-vibrantLaw school's lease of former Ave Maria site keeps area vibrantAnnarbor.com7 November 200921 April 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20140323172219/http://www.annarbor.com/business-review/law-schools-lease-of-former-ave-maria-site-keeps-area-vibrant/2014-03-23
article.heading: Primary and secondary education
article.paragraph: State schoolPublic schoolsare part of theAnn Arbor Public Schools(AAPS) district. AAPS has one of the country's leading music programs. In September 2008, 16,539 students had been enrolled in the Ann Arbor Public Schools. There were 21 elementary schools, fivemiddle schools(Forsythe,Slauson Middle School (Ann Arbor, Michigan)Slauson, Tappan, Scarlett, andClague middle schoolClague) threetraditional educationtraditionalhigh schools (Ann Arbor Pioneer High SchoolPioneer,Huron High School, Ann Arbor, MichiganHuron, andSkyline High School (Ann Arbor, Michigan)Skyline), and threealternative educationalternativehigh schools (Community High School (Ann Arbor, Michigan)Community High, Stone School, and Roberto Clemente) in the district.cite webhttp://www.aaps.k12.mi.us/aaps.about/aaps.data/headcount_by_grade_and_schoolAbout AAPS: Demographics Data—Headcount by Grade and School2008Ann Arbor Public Schools5 December 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20131104200415/http://www.aaps.k12.mi.us/aaps.about/aaps.data/headcount_by_grade_and_school2013-11-04The district also operates a K-8 open school program,cite webhttp://aaopen.a2schools.org/Ann Arbor Open SchoolAnn Arbor Public Schools20074 August 2008Ann Arbor Open School, out of the former Mack School. This program is open to all families who live within the district. Ann Arbor Public Schools also operates a preschool and family center, with programs for at-risk infants and at-risk children beforekindergarten. The district has a preschool center with both free and tuition-based programs for preschoolers in the district.cite webhttp://preschool.a2schools.org/preschool.home/about_our_programAbout Our ProgramsAnn Arbor Preschool & Family Center20094 December 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20120712094244/http://preschool.a2schools.org:80/preschool.home/about_our_program2012-07-12

Ann Arbor is home to more than 20 private schools,cite webhttp://arborweb.com/cg/t0054.htmlCity Guide—Private SchoolsArborweb.com20091 November 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20130923084443/http://arborweb.com/cg/t0054.html2013-09-23including theRudolf Steiner School of Ann Arbor,Clonlara School,Michigan Islamic Academy, andGreenhills School, a prep school. The city is also home to severalcharter schools in the United Statescharter schoolssuch asCentral Academy (Michigan)Central Academy(PreK-12) of theGlobal Educational Excellence(GEE) charter school company,"GEE Academies."Global Educational Excellence. Retrieved on September 1, 2015.Washtenaw Technical Middle College and Honey Creek Community School. At Washtenaw Technical Middle College, students can earn an associate degree at Washtenaw Community College and a high school diploma at the same time.cite webhttp://www.themiddlecollege.org/node/14Our Story: Program description2010Washtenaw Technical Middle College19 October 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20130923045924/http://www.themiddlecollege.org/node/142013-09-23
article.heading: Media
article.paragraph: File:AnnArborHydrant.JPGthumbuprightalt=A painted hydrant with vertical stripes of multiple colorsOne of 39 downtownfire hydrantspainted by students. This hydrant's artist was in elementary school; others were in high school or college.cite webhttp://www.arts.umich.edu/programs/special/firehydrant/index.htmlFire Up DowntownUniversity of Michigan–Arts at Michigan20044 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20071230112927/http://www.arts.umich.edu/programs/special/firehydrant/index.html30 December 2007The Ann Arbor News, owned by the Michigan-basedBooth Newspaperschain, was the major daily newspaper serving Ann Arbor and the rest of Washtenaw County. The newspaper ended its 174-year print run in 2009, due to economic difficulties. It was replaced byAnnArbor.com,cite journalhttp://www.mlive.com/news/ann-arbor/index.ssf/2009/03/ann_arbor_news_to_close_in_jul.htmlMurray, StefanieAnn Arbor News to Close in JulyThe Ann Arbor News23 March 200923 March 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090325075740/http://www.mlive.com/news/ann-arbor/index.ssf/2009/03/ann_arbor_news_to_close_in_jul.html25 March 2009nowhich ceased publication in 2013. Another Ann Arbor-based publication that has ceased production was theAnn Arbor Paper, a free monthly.cite webhttp://www.arborweb.com/cg/t0131.htmlAnn Arbor PublicationsArborweb.com20074 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20080828122719/http://arborweb.com/cg/t0131.html28 August 2008noAnn Arbor has been said to be the first significant city to lose its only daily paper.cite webEdmondsRickhttp://www.poynter.org/latest-news/business-news/the-biz-blog/96340/why-ann-arbor-will-be-the-first-city-to-lose-its-only-daily-newspaper/Why Ann Arbor Will be the First City to Lose its Only Daily Newspaper | PoynterPoynter.16 June 200921 April 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20131110215325/http://www.poynter.org/latest-news/business-news/the-biz-blog/96340/why-ann-arbor-will-be-the-first-city-to-lose-its-only-daily-newspaper/2013-11-10TheAnn Arbor Chronicle, an online newspaper, covered local news, including meetings of the library board, county commission, and DDA until September 3, 2014.cite journalAnn Arbor ObserverHard Times at the Ann Arbor NewsJanuary 2009

Current publications in the city include theAnn Arbor Journal(A2 Journal), a weeklycommunity newspaper;cite webhttp://heritage.com/ann_arbor_journal/Ann Arbor Journal – regional and local newsHeritage.com21 April 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20110209110539/http://heritage.com/ann_arbor_journal/2011-02-09theAnn Arbor Observer, a free monthly local magazine; theAnn Arbor Independent, a locally owned, independent weekly; andCurrent, a free entertainment-focusedAlternative newspaperalt-weekly.cite webhttp://print.awn.org/businesses/ann_arbor_current/85Ann Arbor Current | Alternative Weekly Network | AWN DirectoryPrint.awn.org21 April 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20140317032119/http://print.awn.org/businesses/ann_arbor_current/852014-03-17TheAnn Arbor Business Reviewcovers local business in the area.Car and Drivercite journalMigliore, GregCar and Driver cruising to new Ann Arbor offices6 March 2008Ann Arbor Business Review6 September 2009http://blog.mlive.com/ann_arbor_business_review/2008/03/car_and_driver_cruising_to_new.htmlhttps://web.archive.org/web/20140317031959/http://blog.mlive.com/ann_arbor_business_review/2008/03/car_and_driver_cruising_to_new.html2014-03-17magazine andAutomobile Magazine"Vile Gossip",Jean Jennings,Automobile Magazine, November, 2007are also based in Ann Arbor. The University of Michigan is served by many student publications, including the independentMichigan Dailystudent newspaper, which reports on local, state, and regional issues in addition to campus news.cite webhttp://www.michigandaily.com/aboutAbout the DailyThe Michigan Daily4 August 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20061117174222/http://www.michigandaily.com:80/about/2006-11-17

Four majoramplitude modulationAMradio stations based in or near Ann Arbor areWAAM1600, a conservative news and talk station;WLBY1290, a business news and talk station;WDEO (AM)WDEO990, Catholic radio; andWTKA1050, which is primarily a sports station.cite webhttp://radiostationworld.com/locations/United_States_of_America/Michigan/radio.asp?mRadio Broadcasting Stations—Ann Arbor MIRadioStationWorld20074 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20140423150031/http://radiostationworld.com/Locations/United_States_of_America/Michigan/radio.asp?m2014-04-23The city'sfrequency modulationFMstations includeNational Public RadioNPRaffiliateWUOM91.7; country stationWWWW-FMWWWW102.9; and adult-alternative stationWQKL107.1. Freeform stationWCBN-FM88.3 is a local community radio/college radiostation operated by the students of the University of Michigan featuring noncommercial, eclectic music and public-affairs programming.The city is also served by public and commercial radio broadcasters in Ypsilanti, the Lansing/Jackson area, Detroit, Windsor, and Toledo.cite webhttp://www.michiguide.com/dials/detroit.htmlSoutheast Michigan Radio and TV Dial GuideMichiguide5 August 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20110809053257/http://www.michiguide.com:80/dials/detroit.html2011-08-09

WPXDchannel 31, an affiliate of theION TelevisionION Television network, is licensed to the city.WHTVchannel 18, aMyNetworkTV-affiliated station for theLansing, MichiganLansingmarket, broadcasts from a transmitter inLyndon Township, MichiganLyndon Township, west of Ann Arbor. Community Television Network (CTN) is a city-provided cable television channel with production facilities open to city residents and nonprofit organizations.cite webhttp://www.a2gov.org/government/city_administration/communicationsoffice/ctn/Pages/Home.aspxCommunity Television NetworkAnn Arbor City Government200719 February 2007https://web.archive.org/web/20130808051112/http://www.a2gov.org/government/city_administration/communicationsoffice/ctn/Pages/Home.aspx2013-08-08Detroit and Toledo-area radio and television stations also serve Ann Arbor, and stations from Lansing and Windsor, Ontario, can be heard in parts of the area.
article.heading: Health and utilities
article.paragraph: TheUniversity of Michigan Health SystemUniversity of Michigan Medical Center, the only teaching hospital in the city, took the number 1 slot inU.S. News & World Reportfor best hospital in the state ofMichigan, as of 2015.cite webhttp://health.usnews.com/best-hospitals/area/mi/university-of-michigan-hospitals-and-health-centers-6440110University of Michigan Hospitals and Health Centers2015U.S. News & World Report5 October 2015https://web.archive.org/web/20150906115829/http://health.usnews.com/best-hospitals/area/mi/university-of-michigan-hospitals-and-health-centers-64401102015-09-06The University of Michigan Health System (UMHS) includes University Hospital, C.S. Mott Children's Hospital and Women's Hospital in its core complex. UMHS also operates out-patient clinics and facilities throughout the city. The area's other major medical centers include a large facility operated by theUnited States Department of Veterans AffairsDepartment of Veterans Affairsin Ann Arbor,cite webhttp://www.annarbor.va.gov/about/index.aspVA Ann Arbor Healthcase System—About this FacilityUnited States Department of Veterans Affairs10 July 200723 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20080905144933/http://www.annarbor.va.gov/about/index.asp5 September 2008noand Saint Joseph Mercy Hospital in nearbySuperior Township, Washtenaw County, MichiganSuperior Township.cite webhttp://www.sjmercyhealth.org/bodysub.cfm?idSt. Joseph Mercy HospitalSaint Joseph Mercy Health System200923 August 2009

The city provides sewage disposal and water supply services, with water coming from theHuron River (Michigan)Huron Riverand groundwater sources. There are twowater purificationwater-treatmentplants, one main and three outlying reservoirs, fourpumping stationpump stations, and twowater towers. These facilities serve the city, which is divided into five water districts. The city's water department also operates four dams along the Huron River, two of which providehydroelectric power.cite webhttp://www.ci.ann-arbor.mi.us/PublicServices/Water/WTP/int-treat.htmlhttps://web.archive.org/web/20060127005708/http://www.ci.ann-arbor.mi.us/PublicServices/Water/WTP/int-treat.html27 January 2006Water Treatment2005City of Ann Arbor23 August 2008The city also offers waste management services, withEcology Center (Ann Arbor)Recycle Ann Arbor's handling recycling service.cite webhttp://www.recycleannarbor.org/aboutus/aboutus.htmAbout UsRecycle Ann Arbor20074 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20080327210526/http://www.recycleannarbor.org/aboutus/aboutus.htm27 March 2008Other utilities are provided by private entities.Electric powerElectrical powerandNatural gasgasare provided byDTE Energy.AT&T Inc.is the primary wired telephone service provider for the area.Cable televisionCable TVservice is primarily provided byComcast.cite webhttp://www.arborweb.com/cg/t0137.htmlArborweb—City GuideAnn Arbor Observer200923 August 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20131110213318/http://www.arborweb.com/cg/t0137.html2013-11-10
article.heading: Transportation
Surface roads and paths
article.paragraph: The city is belted by three freeways:Interstate 94 in MichiganI-94, which runs along the southern portion of the city;U.S. Route 23 in MichiganU.S. Highway 23(US 23), which primarily runs along the eastern edge of Ann Arbor; andM-14 (Michigan highway)M-14, which runs along the northern edge of the city. Other nearby highways includeU.S. Route 12 in MichiganUS 12,M-17 (Michigan highway)M-17, andM-153 (Michigan highway)M-153.cite webMichigan HighwaysHighways 10 through 19http://www.michiganhighways.org/listings/MichHwys10-19.html4 August 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20131219073952/http://michiganhighways.org/listings/MichHwys10-19.html2013-12-19Self-published sourceJuly 2014cite webMichigan HighwaysHighways 140 through 159http://www.michiganhighways.org/listings/MichHwys140-159.html4 August 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20131219055826/http://michiganhighways.org/listings/MichHwys140-159.html2013-12-19Self-published sourceJuly 2014

The streets in downtown Ann Arbor conform to agrid pattern, though this pattern is less common in the surrounding areas. Major roads branch out from the downtown district like spokes on a wheel to the highways surrounding the city. Several of the major surface arteries lead to the I-94/M-14 interchange in the west, US 23 in the east, and the city's southern areas.cite map[[Michigan Department of Transportation]]Official 2007 Department of Transportation Maphttp://www.michigan.gov/mdot/0,1607,7-151-9622_11033_11151---,00.html20071 in:15 mi/1 cm:9 kmC1–C114 August 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20140502044505/http://michigan.gov/mdot/0,1607,7-151-9622_11033_11151---,00.html2014-05-02The city also has a system of bike routes andbike pathpathscite webhttp://www.a2gov.org/CommunityServices/Parks/images/bike.pdfhttps://web.archive.org/web/20070605152004/http://www.a2gov.org/CommunityServices/Parks/images/bike.pdf5 June 2007City of Ann Arbor Bikeway System2007City of Ann Arbor and Washtenaw County23 August 2008PDFand includes the nearly complete Washtenaw CountyBorder-to-Border Trail.cite webFriends of the Border to Border Trailhttp://www.bordertoborder.org/https://web.archive.org/web/20131110220623/http://www.bordertoborder.org/2013-11-10
article.heading: Bus service
article.paragraph: TheAnn Arbor Area Transportation Authority(AAATA), which brands itself as "The Ride", operates publicbusservices throughout the city and nearbyYpsilanti, MichiganYpsilanti. A separatezero-farebus service operates within and between the University of Michigan campuses. Since April 2012, route 787 (the "AirRide") connects toDetroit Metropolitan Wayne County AirportDetroit Metro Airporta dozen times a day.cite webhttp://www.michiganradio.org/post/new-airride-bus-travels-between-ann-arbor-and-detroit-metroNew AirRide bus travels between Ann Arbor and Detroit MetroMichigan Radio30 March 2013https://web.archive.org/web/20140323170945/http://michiganradio.org/post/new-airride-bus-travels-between-ann-arbor-and-detroit-metro2014-03-23There are also limited-stop bus services between Ann Arbor andChelsea, MichiganChelseaas well asCanton, MichiganCanton. These two routes, 710 and 711 respectively, are known as the "ExpressRide".Cite webExpress Routes {{!}} Commuter Services {{!}} Services {{!}} AATA - Ann Arbor Transportation Authorityhttp://www.theride.org/Services/CommuterServices/ExpressRouteswww.theride.org2015-10-06TheMichigan Flyer, a service operated by Indian Trails, cooperates with AAATA for their AirRide and additionally offers bus service to East Lansing.cite webhttp://www.michiganflyer.com/Michigan Flyer—HomeMichigan Flyer200926 March 2013https://web.archive.org/web/20140215123518/http://www.michiganflyer.com/2014-02-15

Greyhound Linesprovides out-of-town bus service from 115 E. William, across the street from the Blake Transit Center.Cite press releaseGreyhound Relocates in Ann Arbor, MichiganJuly 8, 2014[[Greyhound Lines|Greyhound Lines, Inc.]]https://www.greyhound.com/en/newsroom/viewrelease.aspx?id20 March 2015Megabus (North America)Megabushas twice daily direct service toChicagoChicago, Illinois, while a bus service is provided byAmtrakfor rail passengers making connections to services inEast Lansing, MichiganEast LansingandToledo, Ohio.
article.heading: Airports
article.paragraph: Ann Arbor Municipal Airportis a small, city-rungeneral aviationairport located south of I-94.Detroit Metropolitan Airport, the area's largeinternational airport, is aboutconvert25mikmeast of the city, inRomulus, MichiganRomulus.cite bookFodor's Where to Weekend Around Chicago1st2004Fodor's978-1-4000-1303-6244Willow Run Airporteast of the city nearYpsilanti, MichiganYpsilantiserves freight, corporate, and general aviation clients.cite webhttp://www.willowrunairport.com/Welcome to Willow Run AirportWayne County Airport Authority200623 August 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20140323135530/http://www.willowrunairport.com/2014-03-23
article.heading: Railroads
article.paragraph: The city was a major rail hub, notably for freight traffic betweenToledo, OhioToledoand ports north ofChicagoChicago, Illinois, from 1878 to 1982; however, theAnn Arbor Railroad (18951976)Ann Arbor Railroadalso provided passenger service from 1878 to 1950.cite webhttp://clarke.cmich.edu/resource_tab/information_and_exhibits/michigan's_ann_arbor_railroads/a_brief_history.htmlA Brief HistoryCentral Michigan University—Clarke Historical Library5 February 201019 October 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20130203085713/http://clarke.cmich.edu:80/resource_tab/information_and_exhibits/michigan's_ann_arbor_railroads/a_brief_history.html2013-02-03The city was also served by theMichigan Central Railroadstarting in 1837. TheAnn Arbor and Ypsilanti Street Railway, Michigan's firstinterurban, served the city from 1891 to 1929.cite webhttp://moaa.aadl.org/moaa/pictorial_history/1880-1899pg4Pictorial History of Ann Arbor 1824–1974 (1880–1899) – Public Transportation and Changes in City Government24 December 200623 August 2009Ann Arbor District Libraryhttps://web.archive.org/web/20140224040422/http://moaa.aadl.org/moaa/pictorial_history/1880-1899pg42014-02-24

Amtrak, which provides service to the city at theAnn Arbor (Amtrak station)Ann Arbor Train Station, operates theWolverine (passenger train)Wolverinetrain between Chicago andPontiac, MichiganPontiac, via Detroit. The present-day train station neighbors the city's old Michigan Central Depot, which was renovated as a restaurant in 1970.cite webDrukas, Alexander J.http://blog.mlive.com/ann_arbor_business_review/2008/03/ann_arbors_classic_brunch_stil.htmlAnn Arbor's classic brunch still delights27 March 20084 August 2012MLive.comhttps://web.archive.org/web/20131104203517/http://blog.mlive.com/ann_arbor_business_review/2008/03/ann_arbors_classic_brunch_stil.html2013-11-04
article.heading: Sister cities
article.paragraph: File:Ann Arbor Sister Cities Sign.JPGthumbuprightrightSister cities sign (missing Remedios, Cuba), S. State St.Ann Arbor has sevenTwin towns and sister citiessister cities:cite webhttp://www.internationalcenter.umich.edu/about/services.htmlOur International Visitor Leadership Program coordinator also serves as the University of Michigan's official representative to the City of Ann Arbor's Sister City Program, which manages relationships with six sister cities: Tübingen, Germany; Hikone, Japan; Dakar, Senegal; Juigalpa, Nicaragua; Peterborough, Canada; and Belize City, Belize.About our servicesUniversity of Michigan International Center31 July 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20080620043345/http://www.internationalcenter.umich.edu/about/services.html20 June 2008noAnn Arbor City Council Minutes (2003-11-06).
